goal: Let players collect muddy water, boil it into clean water, and cook simple foods on a fire with weather/time influencing the effort.
decisions: Reuse the kettle flow for water handling; treat filled kettles as muddy water and return clean water plus the empty kettle after boiling.
Add basic cooked outputs for fish and berries; require a lit fireplace (or fire) and adjust effort when severe weather makes cooking harder.
Keep items minimal: muddy/clean water consumables and cooked variants of fish/berries with modest hydration/fullness effects.
plan: Add items for muddy_water, clean_water, cooked_fish, and roasted_berries with names/weights/descriptions.
Wire kettle flow: filling yields muddy water in the kettle; boiling over a lit hearth produces clean water and returns the kettle; allow tea brewing from clean water too.
Add cooking interactions for fish/berries on a lit fire with weather-aware time/energy tweaks; hook consumption effects for the new foods/drinks.
Run cargo check and update todo tracking.
notes: No new cooking surfaces beyond the existing fireplace; campfire remains future work.
Weather impact kept lightweight: severe storms slightly increase cook time/energy.
progress: Added muddy/clean water and cooked food items with descriptions/weights and kettle flow to boil lake water into clean water while returning the kettle.
Tea brewing accepts clean water (or hot kettle) and water filling/boiling messages guide muddy->clean usage.
Cooking fish/berries on a lit fireplace now produces cooked variants with weather-aware effort; consuming new foods/water affects fullness/hydration/mood.
